WRITING.TEXT: YTA! You will pay for your daughters wedding if she was strait but because she is marrying someone of the same sex you won #8217;t...that is homophobic!!! It #8217;s an AH move to not pay for the wedding because it does not meet your ideals.
This gets me every time! It reminds me #8220;happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light. #8221; Dobby was such a light in a dark place!

NTA! This is a boundary you and your wife have set, whether sister or SIL remember it. In college I took/payed for a neuroscience class where the teacher would spend the first ten minutes of the class on topic and then he would get #8220;bored or neuroscience #8221; (In his own words) He would then start teaching his theory on how in the future we would chop off our own libs, organs, other body parts (willingly) in order to exchange them for bionic parts which would perform better. We as a class would purposely keep him off topic most days by asking about what the olympics and other things would be like, so come test day he would cancel it or give us the answers because #8220;we didn #8217;t learn that #8221;. In my 4 years at university it was the only class I got 100% in. SMH!

NTA!, NTA!!, NTA!!! Stand your ground OP those are your plant children! I get the feeling you payed for them, watered them, and took care of them, what they produce is 100% yours! This lady is reaping what she sewed which is little to NOTHING it sounds like. It crappy of her to use religion as a guilt trip to get what she wants. Sending lots of strong healing vibes OP! (Sorry about all the gardening puns, couldn #8217;t resist)

Don #8217;t think you are in the wrong! First they are your emotions, if you don #8217;t feel it then you don #8217;t. To play devils advocate though it sound like your mom is proud of you. She was expecting you to feel pride in your accomplishment and was saddened when you didn #8217;t have emotion. I graduated from a JR High that had 80kids, 20 in graduating class. I was so ready to get the heck out of there! Didn #8217;t cry, didn #8217;t want to say bye to anyone just wanted out! My parents were mad at me for a week because I wouldn #8217;t stop for pictures.
So you are saying, they copy-CATED him/her?

Four years ago I was in a medically induced coma for 5 days after a tough surgery. It #8217;s weird but I closed my eyes then woke up 5 days later with no clue time passed, and wanted to pick up right where I left off at. I wanted to know how surgery went. Everyone was looking at me as if I was missing something.

Definitely not TA! The part where you said you feel like an ass, could you have said it nicer...but it needed to be said like that because those are your legitimate concerns for his health and he needed to hear it. Sounds like you and husband have a lot of tough conversations ahead! You are never an AH for encouraging your SO/friends/family to be the best thems they can be!

I #8217;m 26F (I look maybe 21) I use a 4 wheel walker to walk because of incomplete quadriplegia. Anyway 100% get this at least once a year from people 60 and above. I had a lady threaten to report me for faking because #8220;your to young for a walker #8221; and #8220;everyone knows your faking #8221;.

In all seriousness everything! Unless you know the person don #8217;t say anything I/we just want to be a person you say hi to. Not that person with disabilities who you want to talk about our disabilities. Here is a list 5 things to definitely not say to someone with a disability that people have said to me. For some context I #8217;m 26F who probably looks 20ish, has incomplete quadriplegia due to cancer 5 years ago, I use walker or wheelchair when out and about. #8220;What did YOU do to be in a wheelchair? #8221; #8220;What can and can #8217;t you do? #8221; #8220;What is your disability? #8221; #8220;Why don #8217;t you just walk like a normal person? #8221; #8220;You are too young to need a walker...you can stop faking it we all know your lying #8221; Just treat everyone the same and talk to them about the same things whether they have a visible disability, hidden disability, brown eyes, green eyes, cute, not cute. Just treat everyone like a person and talk to them about the weather.

I turned around showed her the foot long scar up my back and said #8220;cancer is a cold hearted bitch, I didn #8217;t choose this life, but it #8217;s a great one, because it #8217;s thought me how to deal with ignorant assholes #8221; she stuck up her nose and huffed off.

I am a natural night owl who struggles to sleep at night as well. I have found that a routine is also the best and to do a combination of what everyone has said. My routine is take an epsom salt bath and put my electronics away an hour before bed. After I get out take 1 Advil and go read a book (not in your bed all you should do in bed is sleep, don #8217;t nap in bed ether). When I #8217;m tired I go drink a cup of milk and if I #8217;m hungry I put a small amount of cereal in it. Then lay down and just worry about deep breaths. If you catch yourself saying I can #8217;t fall asleep get up and go read book again. #8220;Sleep is best found when you don #8217;t look for it #8221; Wish you luck!

When I was 9 I was washing my hands ( about 6pm) and the sink behind me turned on. The next day I found out my uncle passed #8220;early in the evening #8221;. When I was 12 I was hanging out in my room and a bottle of perfume tumbled to the floor. We got a call an hour later my parents best friend passed that night. 5 years ago I got to say goodbye to my uncle before he passed and noting happened. I was sold at 9 and no one believes me.

Women #8217;s health/period tracker app!!! It was a game changer! The one I have you track everything everyday (it #8217;s like a diary for me). You log exercise, water, food, period symptoms....cramps acne, mood, hunger, customizable symptoms (bathrooming frequency). Anyway at some point it learns you and gives heads up on what might happen. It is also nice because the months I have an #8220;easy #8221; period I can look and see what I did then try to repeat it, and the #8220;bad #8221; ones I can see what I did different that could have an effect. One more. NEVER be scared to ask for tampons or pads if you don #8217;t have any! A couple times I #8217;ve overheard younger gals whisper to their friends #8220;do you have tampons or pads #8221; #8220;No #8221; #8220;What do I do #8221; Announce to the bathroom does anyone have tampons or pads. 9/10 someone will help you out because we have all been there! Edited to Add Same goes if you are with a guy (BF,Dad,guy friend, whatever) never be afraid! let them know you need a tampon or pad and don #8217;t have any. I once had a guy practically buy the whole isle because had had no idea which one to get.

It kind of has a point but in Arizona fake cocaine is illegal and is charged the same as real cocaine. The law reads #8220;if you make, sell, distribute, or package fake coke it a class 6 felony and your defense can #8217;t be you thought it was real cocaine #8221;. Moral of the law don #8217;t put flour in a zip lock bag in Arizona.

Regarding school: Get to know professors and visit their office twice in the semester. Even if it #8217;s just to tell them what you found interesting in the lecture. 9/10 they won #8217;t fail you if they know your name. Regarding life while at school: Try as many new things as you can that #8217;s how you find out what you like. Take pottery, communication, yoga class... this goes with every day things as well, dye your hair a different color, chop off all your hair, try a new style of clothing, hang out with new people. Regarding safety: Most Universities offer a self defense class (ours was free) take it and brush up one a year. (Only if you are comfortable with it) I would carry pepper spray on my keys. Finally know the safety programs your school offers, we had a walker program. I had a class that got out at 9pm and had to walk in not very well lit and empty part of campus. Well this guy would meet me outside my class and walk me home.

They are insane in person! Swear they can hear you as well don #8217;t make them mad. I was walking by a couple of them and saw all these exploded branches as big as my arm on the ground. I said #8220;wow bet those are the high up branches falling to ground and exploding. That could kill someone #8221;. I start walking back to the car and get 40 steps away and here a skin chilling creaking from above and see a branch falling and explode right where I was standing! I yelled back #8220;nice try! thank you for answering my question #8221;.

I was really surprised that most of the sequoia trees by General Sherman were behind fences and you could not go up to and touch/stand next to them. Makes sense though, imagine if everyone touched them...all the oils on our hands. P. S. My first thought was they don #8217;t look real up close.
When you are at the gift shop you can buy seeds....we can start a live video and have a time lapse video in about...3,000+ years

In sequoia national forest there is a patch of 3-4 that were intentionally set on fire to #8220;see if they could be burned down #8221;. I don #8217;t think we need AITAH to determine that person is an AH!
Yep! If we are talking hypotheticals I would want to interview a sequoia tree on what they have seen and their stories!

WRITING.TITLE: One Pixie Hair Cut
WRITING.TEXT: I have been rocking a supper short pixie haircut for 4+ years now. My original hairstylist quit right before COVID. Then COVID hit and I didn #8217;t feel comfortable getting a haircut. Fast forward six months to yesterday. My hair had grown out to a mullet so I researched for a highly rated place to get it cut. When I got there the stylist ask #8220;ohh you are growing your hair out guess you didn #8217;t like your pixie cut, just a trim? #8221;. I corrected her and tried to make a joke out of it #8220;I love my pixie cut but this is quarantine hair. I want to get it all cut off and back into a pixie style please #8221;. Durning the hair cut she kept saying comments like, #8220;you have such nice hair you would look cute with it to your shoulders #8221; #8220;hmmm when do you think you #8217;ll grow it out again #8221; #8220;Guess you have to be really strong for a woman to cut off all your hair #8221; I had my glasses off so I couldn #8217;t really see. But when she gave my glasses back....my hair looked bad! Pieces all different sizes and just looked very choppy! She ask how I like it (I #8217;m not one to lie if I am not happy) so I said #8220;I #8217;m not happy with it #8221;. That is when she responded with #8220;Well girls shouldn #8217;t get their hair cut to a boys length, maybe you should have gone to a barber #8221;. I took her #8220;advice #8221; and went to the nearest barber. I walk in and explained what happened and asked if they would fix it. He said no problem and fixed it. He told me #8220;it #8217;s a nice break from his day to do a feminine short hair cut, and everyone is welcome here #8221; So my new hair stylist is a barber! Edit: For those asking about payment: The hair cut cost $35. She gave me her #8220;advise #8221; as I walked up to the counter to pay. I wanted to just walk out but she did #8220;a job #8221; and I put $5 on the counter and walked out. Hindsight I paid $5 for the best advise I could have gotten Lol. Edit2:Wowww this is my first post and had no idea it would get this much comments! First I thought I was weird going to the barber guess not. I love how much support there is here and thank you to the many people have shared their hair story. Everyone keeps asking me to rate this hair stylist. I did. Unfortunately Judgy Scissor hands (as one person named her) was the owner. I left reviews everywhere you can, unfortunately the reason I chose her because of great review sooo...I did my best. Finally thank you for the awards kind people! Final edit (probably) I cant go to any of the newer comments and see or reply. All I see are ones from 2 hours ago, but I have notifications on phone. Please feel free to message me if you know what #8217;s going on. Once again thank you for all the kind messages!
Thank you! After 4 years with short hair I am still in love with the style and don #8217;t see myself growing it out.

Also it #8217;s so sad to me that we genderize hair so much. I can #8217;t tell you the number of times I hear your hair is so short it looks like a boy. Like you said we should all just have hairstyles we like and that #8217;s the end of it.
Thank you! I always though of a barber as a guys place. But everyone was so accepting, joking, and talking with me. 100% sticking with a barber now!

Sorry that happened to you! One of the most liberating thing I did was cut my hair into a pixie cut! I had work a year at a restaurant and had my hair in a bun 24/7! I went to my stylist (pre-COVID stylist) and said I need a change and she said do you trust me! It #8217;s history from there!
Aaaaaa yesss! Thank you for posting this!!!
Yes detail! He was talking about my hair line in back and how to cut it the best so that it makes my neck look great....like no stylist has ever talked with me about that.
Haha get this she was the manager/owner SMH! I left a review but when every one is glowing I don #8217;t know if it did any good.
Haha OMG that #8217;s epic! Well maybe I #8217;m AH but hair cut is $35. After he #8220;advice #8221; I set a 5 on the counter and walked out. She still did a #8220;job #8221;.
Sorry this happened to you!!! Ohh man what is it about pixie cuts that are so tough!
Uhhh what is it about pixie cuts that is so hard! Gosh you cut guys hair but it doesn #8217;t translate to pixie cuts I guess??
Nope will have to watch it!
Gosh you and me both! I though it was weird I went to barber but guess it #8217;s totally normal!!
This made me laugh so much!!!
Sorry that happened to you! That was the last judgy assholeery you needed! SMH!
Awww!! Thank you for this!
My hair is very thin as well! And it #8217;s worse the longer it gets. When its in a pixie cut it gets really thick and wavy. That #8217;s one of the reasons I keep it this way!
